data.title: SET UP PAYPAL FOR AN EBAY PAYMENTS ACCOUNT
data.meta_description: IM NEW TO EBAY THIS IS PROBABLEY A VERY BASIC QUESTION BUT IM TRYING TO USE PAYPAL TO PAY EBAY AND GET PAID FROM EBAY I CANT FIND ANY WHERE IN MY
data.text:
IM NEW TO EBAY THIS IS PROBABLEY A VERY BASIC QUESTION BUT IM TRYING TO USE PAYPAL TO PAY EBAY AND GET PAID FROM EBAY I CANT FIND ANY WHERE IN MY ACCOUNT TO DO THAT

@recyclerblue_69

PayPal does not process payments on eBay anymore, so you can't use a PayPal account to receive payments. You have to sign up for a managed payments account, and provide a checking account where your payouts will be deposited.

https://pages.ebay.com/seller-center/service-and-payments/managed-payments-on-ebay.html

Buyers can still use PayPal to pay for purchases, but you will have to create your PayPal account on paypal.com to do that.

@recyclerblue_69

Pay Pal is no longer an option for sellers.

You have to sign up for Managed Payments, providing a checking account and the last 4 of your SSN.

Without that, you won't get paid.

Have a great day.

Why this is is because the contract for PayPal to process payments expired and wasn't renewed.

AYDEN is eBay's payment processor now and after they process your payment they give the proceeds to eBay for disbursement. eBay removes the sales tax and the final value fee from your payment and the balance is deposited in your checking account. It's been like this for many years.

This sucks, i don't want ebay to have my checking account information, by what i can see i dont seem to have any option. Is there no other way to get paid except to give them my checking account infor?

@yogiboy4747 wrote:

This sucks, i don't want ebay to have my checking account information, by what i can see i dont seem to have any option. Is there no other way to get paid except to give them my checking account infor?

Correct. But, that doesnâ€™t mean that you need to give your current bank info. Many have opened an eBay-only checking account.

Hi everyone,

Due to the age of this thread, it has been closed to further replies. Please feel free to start a new thread HERE if you wish to continue to discuss this topic.

Thank you for understanding.
